alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 12:18AM EDT until April 09 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pompton River At Pompton Plains. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 16.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 12/12/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 13.7 Thu 11 p 15.9 14.2 16.8 2pm 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 1230 PM EDT.
